channel.title: Flow-State on Technical Writing Joys and Woes
channel.description: Recent content in Flow-State on Technical Writing Joys and Woes

item.title: Are technical writers 'slow'?
item.author: doug@dougcuff.name (Doug Cuff)
item.description: I spend most of my time at work thinking about the product users. Those are the people who will be reading what I wrote. That means I spend a lot of time considering what each person might not know, and might not know they don’t know. Part of the job of a technical writer is helping people learn. Which puts me in a very different head space than a lot of the people I work with.
